name: Hotel Paba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very small Hotel located in a building shared with other owners. Hotel room was very large, clean, with a big bed. Bathroom had blow dryer on wall. Room had mini fridge, and A.C. above the door. Room was very quiet for a big city. Owner made Taxi calls for us, and provided wake up phone service, and breakfast delivered to room. At night you have to unlock three doors to enter your room, my husband loved the elevator. If you like quiet rooms with personal service, you will love this place. If you like big showy Hotels-keep looking.
reviews.title: Nice large room and bath for European Hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Touring the key sites of Rome and the Vatican means one is out and about most waking hours, so being conveniently located within walking distance of the Colliseum and the Forum plus the metro and buses; while having clean,comfortable, simple, secure overnight accomodations was key to our selection of the Hotel Paba. We were entirely satisfied with our selection of accommodations without paying an outlandish amount of money.
reviews.title: A very clean, comfortable small hotel in a perfect location to tour the Colliseum and Forum.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quite simple, but the room is really comfortable and both the bathroom and the room are very clean. The owner herself takes care of everything, the service is very good. Great location. Only the building is not so good, the lift is very old and is very easy to get into the building, since there're lot`s of offices in there.
reviews.title: Great room, clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved Hotel Paba and Alberta! The place was very clean, quite, & in an excellent location! An Alberta - the perfect hostess - she gave us great ideas for dinner and making our connections to other sights and the airport - she was very helpfull! You can't go wrong with this one!!! Jackson, Michigan USA
reviews.title: Perfect!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can not say enough about Hotel Paba and Alberta. Wonderful location, beautiful room with balcony, warm, clean and comfy, and very quiet even though it is just around the corner from the Colosseo. Alberta was so lovely and always helpful with good advice on eating, travel and bookings. She even bought us breakfast every day. We can highly recommend staying there when in Roma.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in perfect location with perfect host for perfect price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this place on TripAdvisor and were skeptical, but the location and price led us to take a chance. As other reviews identify: amazingly convenient to Roman Forum and Colisseum, as well as transportation. We walked everywhere except to the Vatican. Wifi and large, comfy room. Very helpful staff. Surrounded by little shops and restaurants, including incredible gelateria. Small number of rooms on second (third) floor of unassuming building with offices and apartments. We had balcony onto via Cavour,
reviews.title: Delightful, terrific location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot say enough great things about Hotel Paba. First of all it is a total steal for Rome. The location is AMAZING... just a block from the Roman Forum and only a few blocks from the train station. We actually walked from Termini one day. It took about 20 minutes but was all downhill. Also, the two women who work there are so sweet. They spoke very little English but with our broken Italian we got by just fine. They even called our long lost Italian relatives to help set up meeting them. Our room was massive and very clean with a sitting area, walk-in closet and bathroom. Nothing fancy but lots of space. Each morning they would bring breakfast (yogurt, rolls, jams, juice and cappacuino) into our room. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Best Little Hotel in Rome... Location and Wonderful Hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Site wont let me enter a review with a date of stay that hasnt occurred yet. Forced me to enter Jan 2010 to write this review even though I will be coming to Italy in April.
reviews.title: Staff extemely helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel thru Rick Steves guidebook. Narrowed my Rome accomodation choices down to 3 possibilties for that portion of my 14 day April Italian trip. Contacted all 3 to determine availability for my dates. One not available. Hotel Paba no terrace rooms available. As I had decided to plan a leisurely trip with time to come back to the room and relax on a terrace/balcony with lunch or dinner before going back out I decided to choose the hotel that had an option of a terrace room. Probably could have had this option with Hotel Paba had I made my plans sooner than 4 months in advance. Just wanted everyone to know that I had multiple email correspondences with Hotel Paba and Alberta always answered back promptly. Couldnt have asked for better service. Hopefully I will be able to choose this hotel on a future trip to Rome.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location was great.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay-

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mrs. Castelli, who is the owner of Hotel Paba, was precious and so helpful. She knew buses, subway lines, places to eat, and was just a delight to talk to. Our room was spotless and she served us breakfast in our room every morning. The hotel is around the corner from the Coloseo and down the street from Victor Emmanuel Monument. It is down the block from both the Cavour or Coloseo Metro stations. There is so much to see and do steps from the hotel. You will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: Perfect location and precious owner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I've never been to Italy and my friends booked the rooms. It's within walking distance to the collisium, and great sight seeing. The owners were very nice and accomodating. We all had a great time and felt very safe. If I can ever make it back I will absolutely stay there.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have booked this hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor and I'm glad that I made this choice. We stayed here for 4 nights and if we will come back to Rome we will chose it once again because of price, location, friendly atmosphere.
reviews.title: More that I have expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are larger than some people here were mentioning about...much larger than in France for example. We stayed in room number 2 (the flower room).
reviews.title: Clean Hotel with Air Conditioning, Helpful Staff and Great LOCATION!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with more that I've expected from a 2 star hotel. Probably if this hotel has had more rooms would have been a 3 star hotel or even more.
reviews.title: Excellent two star hotel. Would recommend and stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Paba is a great hotel and Alberta, the owner, is so helpful. The rooms are European is size. They are very clean and very comfortable. We had room 5 which overlooked Via Cavour but the room was still quiet. It is walking distance to the Forum, the Coliseum and many of the sights you want to see. If you want dinner reservations just ask Alberta and she will not only recommend places for you but will also call in the reservation. It is a small hotel on the second floor of a commercial building. There is a breakfast included and Alberta brings it to your room which has a small table and two chairs. We are not big breakfast eaters, so the croissant, yogurt, coffee/tea, juice and rolls were more than enough for us. We had an early pick up to the airport and Alberta was very accommodating in bringing our breakfast early. We used RomeCabs.com and they were very punctual. There are also many travel books in the lobby for your use while staying at Hotel Paba. I would definitely stay there again. You also have free WiFi.
reviews.title: A true jem, great value, Alberta is so helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Family own small hotel with great location. Alberta is really, really nice and everything from restaurant reservations to airport pick-up works impeccable. Quiet hotel, slept like babies and everything very clean, the size of the rooms varies from quite big to quite small. The breakfast is not 5 star, but has all you need. I would definitly go back to Paba if I went to Rome.
reviews.title: Clean, central and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don’t look now, but the Hotel Paba may just be Rome’s very best two-star hotel. After all, this roomy, very clean and comfortable accommodation, also somehow combines a central location while providing the kind of peaceful refuge one needs when traveling to the joyfully loud and lively Eternal City.
reviews.title: Much to be Admired in a Two-Star Category

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Solitude is one of the Paba’s many virtues. Though located on the busy and traffic-heavy Via Cavour, about a` ten-minute walk to Piazza Venezia and the Victor Emmanuel Monument. the Paba, is an oasis of calm, as it features large, high-ceiling rooms, air-conditioning (a must in August), mini-bar, and large double beds. The` author’s room had a movie theme, with posters from Who Framed Roger Rabbit, and a black and white tribute to the Marx Brothers. In addition, this room featured a small addition, with single bed (additional A.C.) and a fair-sized modern bathroom. There was satellite TV, plenty of closet space, and the bath towels were most satisfactory. In short, the Paba offered a room that was ample in space, very tidy, and most appealing - no small feat in the two-star category.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great price, and charming host.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast at the Paba is a bit of an off-beat affair, as the hotel offers room service (there is no breakfast room). While this relative novelty is initially appealing, not too mention tasty, as the food on offer (croissants, yogurt, cappuccino, rolls) is agreeable enough, the concept becomes a little tired with a stay of more than a couple days. Indeed, by day number three, the author had a strong hankering for cereal, Nutella, and an egg or two sunny-side-up. Still, there was something appealing about ringing the Paba’s owner, and presto, within a couple minutes, you’re sitting down to a hot cappuccino.
reviews.title: Best location & service

description: Hotel Paba is a small, but fine two star hotel with elevator on the second floor and every detail is carefully planned. Our location is in the center of Rome, 100 mt. from the Roman Forum, 200 mt. from the Coliseum, Capitol Hill, San Peter in Chains (with Moses by Michelangelo )ecc.. We are steps from the best shopping area and restaurants.
